intro: Epilobium californicum var. occidentale, commonly known as the western willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as streambanks and meadows. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers in clusters. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other species known for their ornamental value. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of riparian ecosystems.
